title: 107_hr2313
content: The Act titled "Crane Tithe Tax Act of 2001" repeals the taxation of corporations. The Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is repealed, including provisions related to corporate income tax, alternative minimum tax for corporations, unrelated business income tax, accumulated earnings tax, personal holding company tax, alternative tax for certain mutual savings banks, tax imposed on life insurance companies, tax imposed on certain mutual insurance companies, tax on certain other insurance companies, and tax on regulated investment companies. The Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is repealed, including provisions related to corporate income tax, alternative minimum tax for corporations, unrelated business income tax, accumulated earnings tax, personal holding company tax, alternative tax for certain mutual savings banks, tax imposed on life insurance companies, tax imposed on certain mutual insurance companies, tax on certain other insurance companies, tax on regulated investment companies, tax on real estate investment trusts, and tax on income of foreign corporations connected with United States business. SEC. 3. 10 PERCENT INCOME TAX RATE FOR INDIVIDUALS. Section 1 of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended to impose a 10 percent income tax rate for individuals. A 10 percent income tax rate is imposed on individuals based on earned income exceeding the exemption amount, which is $10,000 adjusted for the cost of living. The cost-of-living adjustment for any calendar year is based on the percentage difference between the Consumer Price Index (CPI) for October of the preceding year and the CPI for October of 2000. The increase is rounded to the nearest multiple of $10. The definition of earned income includes wages, salaries, net earnings from self-employment, and certain dividends, but excludes certain types of income. The definition of earned income excludes pensions, annuities, and tips at the discretion of the service-recipient. Fringe benefits included as earned income are valued at the employer's cost. SEC. 4. Amnesty for all prior tax liability before January 1, 2000, with exceptions for amounts paid before enactment and taxes from illegal activities. SEC. 5. Repeal of special deductions, credits, and income exclusions for individuals. SEC. 5. REPEAL OF SPECIAL DEDUCTIONS, CREDITS, AND EXCLUSIONS FROM INCOME FOR INDIVIDUALS. Chapter 1 of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended by removing specific exclusions, deductions, and credits related to individual income tax liability. SEC. 6. REPEAL OF ESTATE AND GIFT TAXES. Subtitle B of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 regarding estate, gift, and generation-skipping taxes is repealed. SEC. 7. EFFECTIVE DATES. The amendments made by this Act will apply to taxable years starting after the enactment date. The repeal of estate and gift taxes will be effective for estates of decedents dying and transfers made after the enactment date. The Secretary of the Treasury must submit any necessary technical and conforming changes to the Internal Revenue Code within 90 days of the enactment of this Act.
